articles.title: The true story of Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psycho' isn't like it's depicted in Netflix's 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story'
articles.description: Netflix's 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story' takes some creative liberties with the real story of making Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psycho.'
articles.author: Jason Guerrasio
articles.content: Alfred Hitchcock shows Anthony Perkins the Ed Gein house in 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story.'Netflix  <ul><li>Episode two of 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story' focuses on the making of Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psyc‚Ä¶ [+5620 chars]
articles.full_text: Every time Jason publishes a story, you‚Äôll get an alert straight to your inbox! By clicking ‚ÄúSign up‚Äù, you agree to receive emails from Business Insider. In addition, you accept Insider‚Äôs Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Netflix's "Monster: The Ed Gein Story" appears to have taken some creative liberties when depicting the making of Alfred Hitchcock's "Psycho." Ryan Murphy's twisted anthology series, which focuses on different infamous killers each season like Jeffrey Dahmer and the Menendez brothers, turns to the granddaddy of them all for season 3: Ed Gein, the 1950s-era serial killer who inspired horror classics like "Psycho" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre." A majority of episode two of "The Ed Gein Story" focuses on a series of events that suggest Gein's crimes inspired Hitchcock. The legendary filmmaker, played by Tom Hollander on the show, is shown having meetings with "Psycho" author Robert Bloch and even walking his star Anthony Perkins (Joey Pollari) through a replica of Gein's house on the "Psycho" set to get him in the right mindset to play Norman Bates. But according to Tony Lee Moral, who has written several books on Alfred Hitchcock and his movies, many of the details of this episode are a Ryan Murphy fantasy. In one scene, Perkins believes he's having rehearsals with his costar Janet Leigh, but Hitchcock surprises the actor by bringing him to the "Psycho" set and showing him a replica of the Gein house as it was found when the police arrested him. Along with the disheveled house having shrunken heads in the living room and a skull bowl in the sink, Hitchcock has Perkins open the freezer to find female genitalia. Perkins is in shock that Hitchcock would show him this, and the director tells him that he chose him for the role because, like Gein, he knows Perkins lives with a secret. (At the time of making "Psycho," Perkins was a closeted gay man). Perkins then exits the house and vomits on the studio lot. "There is no historical record of Hitchcock ever reconstructing Ed Gein's house or walking Anthony Perkins through it," Moral told Business Insider. "This sequence in Ryan Murphy's series is best understood as dramatic license, not history." Although Hitchcock's "Psycho" is based on Bloch's book of the same name, and Bloch's mother-loving serial killer is loosely inspired by Gein, in reality, the filmmaker drew even less inspiration from Gein to create his classic horror movie. In "The Ed Gein Story," Hitchcock is depicted as a man captivated by Bloch's tales of Gein's antics. But in truth, the director left most of the story structure to "Psycho" screenwriter Joseph Stefano. "He left me pretty much on my own," Stefano is quoted as saying in "The Dark Side of Genius: The Life of Alfred Hitchcock." Instead, Stefano leaned more into how the master of suspense made his movies than digging into Gein research. "He wanted to talk about almost anything else but the job at hand," Stefano said of working with Hitchcock. "And I felt that if it was going to be done the way he wanted, I'd have to see his films, so I asked to have a number of them screened for me." The fact that the "Psycho" production would have had enough budget to create a detailed replica of Ed Gein's house ‚Äî despite the fact that the set would never appear in the movie ‚Äî is unfounded. "'Psycho' was made under a shoestring budget of $800,000 and filmed with Hitchcock's television crew," said Moral, referring to the crew Hitchcock already had for his TV series "Alfred Hitchcock Presents." "The Bates house and motel were built by his design team as fictional constructs, not replicas of the Gein farmhouse." Moral also points out how unlikely it is that Hitchcock would go to these kinds of lengths for one of his actors, given that the director once famously described actors as cattle. "Hitchcock largely avoided discussing character motivations with his actors and deplored method acting," Moral said. "It's also very unlikely that Hitchcock told Perkins that he cast him for his hidden homosexuality. Perkins was likely cast because he was known for playing boy-next-door types, and Hitchcock loved to subvert the audience's expectations and shock them with contrast, which is why he killed Janet Leigh, the major star, less than halfway through the movie." Netflix and a rep for Ryan Murphy did not respond to requests for comment. Though "The Ed Gein Story" depicts Perkins puking his guts out, in actuality, he was fond of working on "Psycho" and even starred in its three sequels. "I enjoyed making 'Psycho,'" Perkins said in "The Dark Side of Genius." "In fact, I accepted the film before I'd even read the script. [Hitchcock and I] got on very well, and he let me make several changes and suggestions. It was my idea that I should eat candy throughout the film. I thought it would be more interesting if the killer were a compulsive candy-eater." The Hitchcock/Perkins subplot concludes in episode three, with Perkins coming to terms with the fact t
articles.rewritten_text: Netflix's "Monster: The Ed Gein Story" inaccurately portrays Alfred Hitchcock's development of "Psycho," according to Hitchcock expert Tony Lee Moral. The series falsely depicts Hitchcock recreating Gein's house and using it to inspire actor Anthony Perkins, who played Norman Bates.

articles.title: ‚ÄòI Fear This Is Me‚Äô: Florida Man Says There‚Äôs ‚ÄòNothing Better‚Äô Than Having A Ryan Fitzpatrick In Your Boys Group. Here‚Äôs What He Means
articles.description: Heading out for a night at the bar means assembling your squad. Whether you‚Äôre headed out on a night of debauchery or just want an evening with the boys, everyone has their own part to play. Maybe you‚Äôre the funny guy; maybe you‚Äôre the gregarious type that tu‚Ä¶
articles.author: Braden Bjella
articles.content: Audio By Carbonatix  Heading out for a night at the bar means assembling your squad.  Whether youre headed out on a night of debauchery or just want an evening with the boys, everyone has their own p‚Ä¶ [+3452 chars]
articles.full_text: Via @nickysmokes TikTok/NFL TikTok Via @nickysmokes TikTok/NFL TikTok Audio By Carbonatix Heading out for a night at the bar means assembling your squad. Whether you‚Äôre headed out on a night of debauchery or just want an evening with the boys, everyone has their own part to play. Maybe you‚Äôre the funny guy; maybe you‚Äôre the gregarious type that turns a small hang into a group event. No matter who you are, you play an essential role in keeping the night going and the people happy. However, if you‚Äôre looking for someone to add to your crew, one user on TikTok recently sparked discussion with his recommendation: a ‚ÄúRyan Fitzpatrick.‚Äù But what does that mean? In TikTok user Nicky‚Äôs video, which currently has over 57,000 views, he says that adding a ‚ÄúRyan Fitzpatrick‚Äù to a friend group is essential. ‚ÄúThere is nothing better than having a Ryan Fitzpatrick in your friend group,‚Äù Nicky (@nickysmokes) states. ‚ÄúYou know, the guy that‚Äôs almost 40. He‚Äôs been in the league for 20 years. You would think he has a ring by now and he‚Äôs ready to retire, but he‚Äôs not. He‚Äôs just hopping from bar to bar like Ryan Fitzpatrick hopped from team to team.‚Äù The reasons for having such a character, Nicky says, are many. First, they have experience. Second, they take chances. Third, they do not fear rejection. Finally, as Nicky puts it, ‚ÄúHe loves the game.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs nowhere else he‚Äôd rather be than out there on the field with his men, ready to go to battle,‚Äù Nicky summarizes. Nicky closes by reiterating that every crew should at the very least consider adopting an ‚Äúunc.‚Äù ‚ÄúIf you do not have a Ryan Fitzpatrick in your friend group, you are missing out, brother, because that man is a leader,‚Äù he shares. ‚ÄúThat man is the culture. That man will lead you through battle.‚Äù If you read the past few paragraphs wondering who Ryan Fitzpatrick is, well, you probably haven‚Äôt watched football for a while. That‚Äôs because Fitzpatrick was a solid player for a long, long time. How long? Try 17 seasons before announcing his retirement in 2022. During that time, he had some pretty major accomplishments. He played at least one game across nine different NFL teams. He was the first NFL quarterback to throw for over 400 yards in three consecutive games. He also has the most career passing yards and touchdowns of any NFL quarterback without a post-season appearance. That depends. On the field, Fitzpatrick was known for consistently giving it his all and rallying the team, even into his 17th season. He was also, given his experience, fairly older than his teammates. While the average age of an NFL player is just around 26, Fitzpatrick began his last season approaching his 39th birthday. So, are you comfortable having someone significantly older than you in the friend group? A decent amount of people are. Some studies have found that about four in 10 people have an intergenerational friendship. However, whether adding a ‚ÄúRyan Fitzpatrick‚Äù leads to greater social success will depend on your Fitzpatrick‚Äîand your friend group. There‚Äôs nothing better than having a Ryan Fitzpatrick in your friend group #jokes #dating #football #nfl #unc ‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì Nickysmokess In the comments section, some users said they could envision themselves getting their own Ryan Fitzpatrick. Others realized that they were, in fact, their group‚Äôs Ryan Fitzpatrick. ‚ÄúUs unc got all the good stories. Can‚Äôt tell you how many crazy situations I got myself into lmao,‚Äù wrote a user. ‚ÄúI fear this is me. Plenty of playoff runs, no ring, currently on a 7 day bender,‚Äù offered another. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the fitzmagic of my friends,‚Äù declared a third. ‚ÄúI fear most groups don‚Äôt have one,‚Äù noted a further TikToker. BroBible reached out to Nicky via TikTok and Instagram direct message.
articles.rewritten_text: A viral TikTok video suggests every friend group needs a "Ryan Fitzpatrick" - an experienced, fearless member who's older but brings leadership and enthusiasm. The term references the NFL quarterback known for his 17-season career across nine teams and unwavering dedication to the game.

articles.title: Jordi Alba Becomes Second of Lionel Messi‚Äôs Barcelona Teammates to Announce Retirement
articles.description: Jordi Alba has announced he will retire from professional soccer after Inter Miami's run in the MLS playoffs.
articles.content: Jordi Alba has announced that he will retire from professional soccer at the conclusion of Inter Miami's run in the Major League Soccer playoffs, making him the second of Lionel Messi's longtime team‚Ä¶ [+1207 chars]
articles.full_text: Jordi Alba has announced that he will retire from professional soccer at the conclusion of Inter Miami's run in the Major League Soccer playoffs, making him the second of Lionel Messi's longtime teammates to say this year will be his last. Alba revealed the news Tuesday, three days after Inter Miami held a retirement ceremony for Sergio Busquets. Alba was under contract with Inter Miami through 2027. "The time has come to close a truly meaningful chapter in my life," Alba said on social media. "I've decided to bring my professional football career to an end at the conclusion of this season. I do so with complete conviction, with peace and with happiness because I feel I've walked this path with every ounce of passion I had, and now it's just the right moment to open a new chapter and close the previous one with the best possible feeling." The 36-year-old Alba came to Inter Miami not long after Messi announced he was headed there in June 2023. Messi‚Äôs arrival led to Busquets, Luis Suarez and Alba ‚Äî all teammates in Barcelona ‚Äî joining MLS. Alba helped Barcelona win six La Liga titles, five Copa del Rey trophies and the Champions League in 2015. Reporting by The Associated Press. Want great stories delivered right to your inbox? The 36-year-old defender, who joined Inter Miami in 2023 alongside Lionel Messi, ends his career after winning multiple titles with Barcelona, including six La Liga championships.

articles.title: ‚ÄòBlame other drivers‚Äô: The bad driving habits Australians can‚Äôt stop admitting to
articles.description: While most drivers are guilty of occasionally breaking road rules, Aussies are sharing the bad driving habits they can't shake.
articles.author: Ethan Cardinal
articles.content: Concerningly, 38 per cent of respondents admitted they had been involved in an accident (or had a near miss) due to losing attention, with one in four drivers stating they were preoccupied by a smart‚Ä¶ [+34 chars]
articles.full_text: While most drivers are guilty of occasionally breaking local road rules, Aussies are sharing the bad driving habits they can't shake. Although most Australian drivers try their best to abide by the road rules, new data has revealed the most common bad driving habits that Aussies can't shake. In a recent survey conducted by AAMI Insurance, which polled more than 1000 local drivers, approximately nine in 10 Australian drivers admitted to driving while distracted. RELATED: ‚ÄòThey‚Äôre the worst‚Äô: The Australian state with the worst drivers Concerningly, 38 per cent of respondents admitted they had been involved in an accident (or had a near miss) due to losing attention, with one in four drivers stating they were ‚Äúpreoccupied‚Äù by a smartphone or smart watch while driving. Additionally, 60 per cent ‚Äì or two-thirds ‚Äì of Australians confessed to being distracted by playing with their music or GPS, while a whopping 65 per cent admitted to eating or drinking a non-alcoholic drink behind the wheel ‚Äì which is technically against the rules. The survey also found 40 per cent of motorists were preoccupied by other road users, including accidents and even pedestrians. Despite less than half of the respondents admitting to gawking at an accident, AAMI motor prevention manager Mary Kennedy said more than 60 per cent blamed other drivers for the same behaviour. ‚ÄúThis shows we tend to be biased towards our own behaviours, believing we are safer drivers compared to others,‚Äù Kennedy said. ‚ÄúAustralian drivers view their own behaviour behind the wheel through rose-tinted glasses." Despite knowing they're in the wrong, the report found almost a quarter of participants said they refused to change their bad behaviour unless they had a personal experience with road trauma. According to a report commissioned by the Australian Automobile Association ‚Äì the national industry body ‚Äì distracted driving accounts for approximately 16 per cent of serious road crashes. ‚ÄúDistracted driving is as serious a problem on Australian roads as drink driving. It impairs reaction time (including braking and swerving) and diminishes the ability to maintain speed and lane position,‚Äù the report concluded. However, it‚Äôs not just distracted driving that should be a cause for concern, as motorists also admitted to other dangerous driving habits. A survey of more than 1000 Australian motorists by Compare the Market found speeding was the second-most cited behaviour (24 per cent) behind eating and drinking while driving (27 per cent). Conversely, approximately 18 per cent of participants admitted to driving under the speed limit, while 13 per cent of respondents confessed to having road rage. A whopping 61 per cent of Australians surveyed said they were victims of road rage in the form of another driver‚Äôs use of angry gestures (27 per cent), tailgating (25.6 per cent), as well as yelling and shouting (20.3 per cent). Ethan Cardinal graduated with a Journalism degree in 2020 from La Trobe University and has been working in the fashion industry as a freelance writer prior to joining Drive in 2023. Ethan greatly enjoys investigating and reporting on the cross sections between automotive, lifestyle and culture. Ethan relishes the opportunity to explore how deep cars are intertwined within different industries and how they could affect both casual readers and car enthusiasts.
articles.rewritten_text: A new AAMI Insurance survey reveals nine in ten Australian drivers admit to distracted driving, with 38% reporting accidents or near-misses due to inattention. Common distractions include smartphones, GPS use, and eating while driving, with 65% confessing to consuming food or non-alcoholic beverages behind the wheel.

articles.title: Darlington Nagbe to retire at end of 2025 season: A midfield legacy spanning three MLS giants
articles.description: Darlington Nagbe, one of the most consistent and respected midfielders in MLS history, will retire after the 2025 season. From Portland to Atlanta to Columbus, his influence helped define three championship-caliber teams.
articles.author: Felipe Fernandes da Silva
articles.content: On Monday afternoon, veteran MLS reporter Tom Bogert confirmed what fans across the league have long suspected: Darlington Nagbe, the midfield maestro of Columbus Crew and one of Major League Soccers‚Ä¶ [+3350 chars]
articles.full_text: On Monday afternoon, veteran MLS reporter Tom Bogert confirmed what fans across the league have long suspected: Darlington Nagbe, the midfield maestro of Columbus Crew and one of Major League Soccer‚Äôs most influential players, will retire at the conclusion of the 2025 season. A Letter From The Captain ‚úçÔ∏èDarlington Nagbe has announced he will retire at the end of the 2025 season. pic.twitter.com/GOHNeyzOS0 At 35, Nagbe‚Äôs career reads like a masterclass in consistency and positional intelligence. Drafted second overall in the 2011 MLS SuperDraft out of the University of Akron, he became the first-ever player selected by the Portland Timbers in their modern MLS era. Over seven seasons and more than 200 appearances, Nagbe steadily transformed from a promising rookie into a club legend. Role Model. Leader. LE6END üíé pic.twitter.com/UXSfJ976vR His crowning achievement in Portland came in 2015, when he helped lead the club to its first MLS Cup title‚Äîa triumph that solidified his place among the league‚Äôs elite. Nagbe‚Äôs ability to retain possession under pressure and control the game‚Äôs tempo gave Portland a tactical edge few midfielders could replicate. BREAKING: Columbus Crew midfielder and MLS legend Darlington Nagbe is retiring after the 2025 MLS season, per sources.Nagbe, 35, is a four-time MLS Cup winner (2015, 2018, 2020, 2023) with three clubs (Portland, Atlanta, Columbus).One of MLS's best-ever midfielders üëè pic.twitter.com/g6DE8ZAYhq In 2018, Nagbe joined an ambitious Atlanta United side and seamlessly integrated into one of the most electrifying squads in league history. Across three seasons and 74 appearances, he linked up with stars like Miguel Almir√≥n and Josef Mart√≠nez to capture the 2018 MLS Cup‚Äîironically defeating his former team, Portland, in the final. Nagbe‚Äôs contribution went beyond stats. His composure, crisp distribution, and ability to dictate rhythm embodied the classical midfielder archetype. The following year, he added a U.S. Open Cup title to his growing trophy collection, further solidifying his status as one of the league‚Äôs most quietly dominant players. At 30, Nagbe returned to his home state to join Columbus Crew‚Äîushering in what would become perhaps the most defining chapter of his career. Over five seasons and 212 matches, he became the club‚Äôs beating heart, helping deliver MLS Cup titles in 2020 and 2023, and the 2024 Leagues Cup. But it wasn‚Äôt just about silverware. Nagbe became a locker room leader, a mentor to younger teammates, and the cultural backbone of the Crew. His presence was felt not only in midfield but across the club‚Äîon the field, in training sessions, and throughout the Columbus community. A Midfield Titan Across Three Clubs Nagbe may not top the charts for goals or flashiest highlights, but few players have ever matched his consistency, influence, and tactical intelligence. To have anchored three separate MLS clubs‚Äîeach of them lifting major trophies during his tenure‚Äîis a rare feat. As the 2025 season winds down, Darlington Nagbe walks toward retirement not just as a champion, but as a standard-bearer of what elite midfield play can look like in MLS. His legacy, built on calm in chaos and unshakable control, will endure long after his final match.
articles.rewritten_text: Four-time MLS Cup winner Darlington Nagbe announced his retirement, effective after the 2025 season. The 35-year-old midfielder's illustrious career spans three clubs - Portland Timbers, Atlanta United, and Columbus Crew - where he consistently demonstrated exceptional skill and leadership, winning multiple championships.

articles.full_text: Amazon made a bizarre move by editing guns out of the James Bond posters, which has left fans perplexed. Earlier this year, Amazon MGM Studios paid $1 billion to get creative control over the James Bond franchise. Ever since Dr. No was released in 1962, the Broccoli family has led the 007 films. Now, there‚Äôs a big question mark surrounding one of the longest-running franchises. After Daniel Craig‚Äôs final outing, No Time To Die, was released in 2021, fans have been eager to find out what‚Äôs next for the franchise. Who will play the character? Will the tone shift back to the earlier film‚Äôs more exaggerated fun style, or stick with the darker themes from the Craig era? Ever since Amazon took control in February, fans have been concerned about Bond‚Äôs future. With these new altered posters, their apprehension is only growing. As you can see in the post below, Bond posters that once included guns now show the former Bonds in awkward positions. While Amazon has not explicitly said why this choice was made, it‚Äôs likely due to the current political climate. ‚ÄúJust being disarming, darling‚Äùhttps://t.co/41P6Tkg2PK pic.twitter.com/KQQYif7d0q Gun control is one of the biggest hot-button issues out there. Mass shootings have become commonplace in the United States, while the people in charge refuse to take gun reform seriously. The topic has only become more heated in recent weeks due to the assassination of Charlie Kirk. The right-wing podcaster was previously quoted as saying gun deaths were ‚Äúworth it‚Äù to protect the Second Amendment. The fact that he was killed by a gun has only fueled the debate, leaving both sides of the aisle more passionate about their stance than ever. Likely, Amazon didn‚Äôt want one of its biggest franchises to be instantly associated with guns. The problem? James Bond is a spy, and having a gun is a huge part of his identity. Bonds fans are confused about Amazon‚Äôs choice to remove guns from the posters. People were already skeptical about the sale, and this decision isn‚Äôt helping. ‚ÄúI still can‚Äôt believe that Amazon thought it was a good idea to photoshop the James Bond posters to erase the gun from them. The absurdity of the reasoning leaves me speechless,‚Äù one fan wrote. Je n‚Äôen reviens toujours pas qu‚ÄôAmazon se soit dit que c‚Äô√©tait une bonne id√©e de photoshoper les affiches des James Bond afin d‚Äôy effacer le flingue. L‚Äôabsurdit√© de la r√©flexion me laisse sans voix. pic.twitter.com/XQUuTWKZHl ‚ÄúHey @AmazonMGMStudio, WTF is wrong with you? Get your [expetive] together and fast. You‚Äôre about to alienate your core fanbase and destroy the franchise you paid billions for. Bond is an ASSASSIN. He is NOT a GQ model. This is what creative control looks like? Are you total idiots?‚Äù another fan wrote. Hey @AmazonMGMStudio , WTF is wrong with you? Get your sh*t together and fast. You‚Äôre about to alienate your core fanbase and destroy the franchise you paid billions for. Bond is an ASSASSIN. He is NOT a GQ model. This is what creative control looks like? Are you total idiots? pic.twitter.com/VBjWzctQXo ‚ÄúNotice in these Amazon #JamesBond digital posters they‚Äôve removed all the guns and given awkward poses? Welcome to a world where promoting James Bond 007 needs to be done without his sidearm,‚Äù one person observed. Notice in these Amazon #JamesBond digital posters they‚Äôve removed all the guns and given awkward poses?Welcome to a world where promoting James Bond 007 needs to be done without his sidearm. pic.twitter.com/3NGkxXShcn While no one from Amazon has made any specific statements about the Bond posters, they have since quietly removed the edited versions. It‚Äôs clear the backlash was loud enough that they realized their mistake. However, the damage is done when it comes to shaking up people‚Äôs faith in their ability to lead the longstanding franchise. The biggest test for Amazon will ultimately be the Bond casting. There have been rumors swirling over the last couple of years with names ranging from Tom Holland and Aaron Taylor-Johnson to Richard Madden and Henry Cavill. Whoever the next 007 is, Amazon has some big shoes to fill from the Broccoli family. The internet is chaotic‚Äîbut we‚Äôll break it down for you in one daily email. The move has angered fans who argue that firearms are integral to the spy character's identity. Amazon hasn't commented on the alterations.

articles.title: Windows 10 End of Life - what does it mean for PC gamers?
articles.description: If you‚Äôre unsure if you‚Äôll still be able to play your favorite games when Microsoft kills Windows 10 support, we‚Äôve got all the answers.
articles.author: Jasmine Mannan
articles.content: The clock is ticking for Windows 10. For the past decade, it's been the operating system of choice for millions of PC gamers, offering a (relatively) stable and reliable platform for countless virtua‚Ä¶ [+6320 chars]
articles.full_text: The clock is ticking for Windows 10. For the past decade, it's been the operating system of choice for millions of PC gamers, offering a (relatively) stable and reliable platform for countless virtual adventures. But as of October 14, 2025, Microsoft is officially ending support for Windows 10. This means if you're still clinging on to the old OS, it's time to seriously consider making the jump to Windows 11. Ignoring the upgrade could leave you vulnerable to security risks and, more importantly for gamers, potentially out in the cold when it comes to your favorite titles. Before continuing, it‚Äôs worth noting that you don‚Äôt have to upgrade to Windows 11 right away - you can continue using a Windows 10 device, it‚Äôll just be unsupported. However, using Windows 10 after October 14, 2025, poses significant risks for PC gamers. Without updates, security vulnerabilities will increase, threatening personal data. Game compatibility and performance will decline as developers cease optimization, leading to lower frame rates, crashes, and eventually, the inability to run new games, effectively rendering the system obsolete. For many PC gamers, the news of Windows 10 reaching its end of life casts a long shadow over the cherished and often extensive digital game libraries they've cultivated over the years. A paramount concern revolves around compatibility: will the vast collection of titles on platforms like Steam still function as expected? What about popular, ongoing live-service games such as Roblox, which demand consistent updates and online connectivity? Initially, there's good news: many existing platforms and individual games are likely to continue running, at least for a transitional period, on an unsupported Windows 10 operating system. However, this is unsustainable in the long term. Sign up for breaking news, reviews, opinion, top tech deals, and more. The cessation of official support from Microsoft for Windows 10 initiates a gradual but inevitable decline in its viability as a gaming platform. Without the security patches, bug fixes, and underlying system optimizations that come with active support, the operating system becomes increasingly vulnerable and less efficient. More critically for gamers, this lack of official backing means that software developers, including those responsible for game engines, development tools, and, crucially, the games themselves, will eventually cease to guarantee compatibility with Windows 10. While gaming giants like Valve (the company behind Steam) haven't issued an explicit statement regarding an end to Windows 10 support, the industry trend is clear. Major platforms will inevitably align their development roadmaps with actively supported operating systems. This means that future updates to the Steam client, or other launchers like Epic Games Store, might introduce features or technical requirements that are not fully compatible with an outdated Windows 10 device. Gamers could find themselves unable to access new platform features, or even facing issues with the client itself. Game developers, from independent studios to large AAA publishers, operate on finite resources. Their development and optimization efforts will naturally prioritize Windows 11, which offers the latest security features, and performance enhancements. If you continue to game on Windows 10, you may face the following issues: In essence, while the transition may not be immediate or sudden, the end of life for Windows 10 marks the beginning of a slow but undeniable process where PC gamers remaining on the unsupported OS will likely be left behind. Their gaming experience will degrade, characterized by declining performance, unaddressed issues, and an eventual inability to participate in the latest and greatest offerings the gaming world has to offer. The incentive to upgrade to a supported operating system, primarily Windows 11, will become increasingly compelling as these challenges mount. Upgrading to Windows 11 is not just about staying current; it's about future-proofing your gaming experience. Don't get caught out when your favorite games stop playing nice with your old OS. Make the switch sooner rather than later for the best safety and security. Below, you'll find some of our recommendations for gaming laptops depending on your budget. Make sure you check out our best gaming laptops and best budget gaming laptop guides as well for more expert buying advice. Jasmine is a gaming hardware and tech journalist with an appreciation for all things others dare to call boring or complicated. Previously of GamesRadar and The Mirror, Jasmine has reviewed and covered hundreds of devices from laptops to sound bars, monitors to cameras and almost everything in-between. In her spare time, Jasmine enjoys playing games that make her rage and building PCs, which also makes her rage ‚Äì as well as spending time with her three cats. Crazy cat lady in the making! articles.rewritten_text: Microsoft will end Windows 10 support on October 14, 2025, prompting PC gamers to consider upgrading to Windows 11. While existing games may continue working initially, the lack of security updates and declining developer support will eventually impact game compatibility and performance, potentially limiting access to new titles.
